result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall M Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Statement of negotiated plea.

Defendant, Randall M Hoffman appeared(w/sister Connie Tesky at the defense table).  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victims rights complied with.  Court advises to rights of an attorney - FVI. Deft enters a plea of no contest to 15CM101 - Count 1
15CF209 Count 1 - DRI.  Enters a plea of no contest to Count 2(amended), 3&4   15CF244 - Enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 amended and Count 2   Count 3 DRI.

Court orders:
15CF209:
24 months probation w/held

  Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
  Take all prescribed medications
  DNA sample unless already done.
15CF244:
24 months probation w/held
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
  Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
  AODA assessment and treatment



15CM101:
12 months probation
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
AODA assessment and treatment 
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  
Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or go on tavern/bar premises

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: of Dr Adrea McGlynn and Lavaughn Brathwaite
live w/mother while action is pending.  Take all  prescribed medication.
live w/mother while action is pending.  Take all  prescribed medication.

Case called Appearances given at 2:29 pm.  Trouble with video.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Deft feels that he is competent to proceed.   Adrianne McGlynn   duly sworn and testifies.  Doctor McGlynn feels that the deft can be discharged and if the court were to discharge would not have to return to Mendota.    Deft does not have any questions.  Court questions the deft.

Court rules to find the deft competent and releases him from the committment.  Court proceedings will start in the three cases.  Doctor informs the court the deft needs to stay on the medication.  Court orders continued administration of medications.  Bond is amended to a signature bond 

State addresses the court.  And would like to do the agreement and take the pleas.  .  Sister Connie Teske (sister) addresses the court.  Court rules to amend the bond in 15CM244 to a sign bond and removes the cash.  Court to schedule the plea and sentencing.
8/10/16 hearing
from Mendota Mental Health Institution for a Hearing regarding competency on 8/10/16 @ 2:00 pm
Hearing on August 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
quarterly review
of Commitment for Treatment (incompetency)

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody by video.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called appearances given.  Victim rights have been complied with.  No attorney has been obtained.  Deft's moth MFH in the courtroom.  Dr Michael Galli  duly sworn and testifies.  Dr Galli has found the deft incompetent to proceed in the court proceedings.   Dr Galli has identified the deft on the video.  Court asks the deft if he has any questions.  State addresses the court.  Court rules to order an Order of Commitment to Inpatient treatment on all charges in the three cases.  Court finds the deft incompetent to proceed at this time could be restored within a year.  Proceedings are suspended at this time in all cases.  
Days credit at follows: zero days in 15CF209; one day in 15CM101 and 215 days in 15CF244.  Court signs the necessary orders at this time.
Competency hearing on May 16, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All three cases called.  Appearances given.  Victim righs complied with.  Court addresses the deft as to the receiving of the report.  Clerk made copy of the report for the deft.  Deft to review the report.  Connie Teske (sister of deft) is questioned by the court.  Court addresses the sister.  Will need to schedule more time for this case.  For the next hearing we will need the Doctor who wrote the report to appear in person.
MG

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by court as to counsel - Defendant has not contacted counsel - Court reads information to defendant - Statements by Hoffman regarding bail modification - Response by State - Court denies motion to modify bond  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 10:50 am.
Arraignment at 11-05-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant - Recess taken so DA can speak to Attorney Hersil's office - Defendant has not retained counsel - Defendant spoke to PD office and advised that he did not want a Public Defender - Defendant states he does not remember having the Public Defender office meet with him at the jail - Defendant is to contact the Public Defenders office from the jail -  Arraignment scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Arraignment at 10-30-2015 01:30 pm
Sent hearing notice to attorney Hersil

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Matthew Wade called - Sworn - Direct by Dunphy - Defendant identified by witness - Arguments by Dunphy to probable cause - Court finds probable cause that a felony had been committed and binds defendant over for further proceedings - Information filed with court - In receipt - Court will put on for arraignment - Court advises defendant to contact PD office to obtain counsel - Defendant states he has already completed paperwork - Defendant states Hersil will be representing him - Arguments by defendant regarding bail - Arguments by Dunphy - Court will not modify bail at lthis time  Arraignment scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 10-26-2015 04:00 pm

Defendant Randall M Hoffman in court, in custody via video.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint - Right to counsel - Defendant is trying to get counsel - Dunphy to bail, requests cash - Court sets $500 cash  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
